Class AsyncOperator

java.lang.Object
org.apache.opendal.NativeObject
org.apache.opendal.AsyncOperator
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class AsyncOperator extends NativeObject
AsyncOperator represents an underneath OpenDAL operator that accesses data asynchronously.

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static AsyncOperator of(ServiceConfig config)
      Construct an OpenDAL operator.
      Parameters:
      config - the config of the underneath service to access data from.

    • of

      public static AsyncOperator of(ServiceConfig config, AsyncExecutor executor)
      Construct an OpenDAL operator.
      Parameters:
      executor - the underneath executor to run async operations; null to use a default global executor.

    • of

      public static AsyncOperator of(String scheme, Map<String,String> map)
      Construct an OpenDAL operator:

      You can find all possible schemes here and see what config options each service supports.

      Parameters:
      scheme - the name of the underneath service to access data from.
      map - a map of properties to construct the underneath operator.

    • of

      public static AsyncOperator of(String scheme, Map<String,String> map, AsyncExecutor executor)
      Construct an OpenDAL operator:

      You can find all possible schemes here and see what config options each service supports.

      Parameters:
      scheme - the name of the underneath service to access data from.
      map - a map of properties to construct the underneath operator.
      executor - the underneath executor to run async operations; null to use a default global executor.

    • duplicate

      public AsyncOperator duplicate()
      Clone a new operator that is identical to this one. The new operator has its own lifecycle.

      Since an operator will release all its resource and "flush" on lifecycle end, this method is suitable to create a narrowed "scope" while avoiding creating a brand-new operator for each scope.

      Returns:
      the cloned operator.

    • layer

      public AsyncOperator layer(Layer layer)
      Create a new operator that is layered with the given layer.

      Note that the current operator is not modified. The returned operator is a new instance. You must close the current operator on demand to avoid resource leak.

      Parameters:
      layer - the layer to be applied.
      Returns:
      the layered new operator.

    • blocking

      public Operator blocking()
      Create a new operator that performs every operation blocking.

      Note that the current operator is not modified. The returned operator is a new instance. You must close the current operator on demand to avoid resource leak.

      Returns:
      the blocking new operator.
